snippet: A raft of lawsuits by politicians, shareholders and prosecutors against several large banks could complicate efforts to by Spain to clean up its banking sector.
abstract: Raft of lawsuits by politicians, shareholders and prosecutors against several large banks could complicate efforts by Spain to clean up its banking sector; Spanish judge orders politician and former International Monetary Fund head Rodrigo Rato to appear in court to face criminal fraud accusations over his recent stewardship of mortgage lender Bankia.
lead_paragraph: A raft of lawsuits by politicians, shareholders and prosecutors against several large banks could complicate efforts to by Spain to clean up its banking sector.

headline.main: Spain’s Banking Crisis Moves Into the Courtroom
headline.print_headline: In Spain, A Banking Crisis Goes To Court
